headline: Updated Guidelines for Non-Pharmacological Dementia Interventions
snippet: New clinical practice guidelines recommend multimodal cognitive stimulation and personalized activity programs as first-line non-drug interventions for dementia.

headline: Telehealth Dementia Care Model Reduces Hospitalizations by 30%
snippet: Integrated telehealth program combining remote monitoring and virtual consultations significantly reduces emergency department visits for dementia patients.

headline: Caregiver Support Program Shows Improved Patient Outcomes
snippet: Structured caregiver education and respite program leads to reduced behavioral symptoms and delayed nursing home placement for dementia patients.

headline: Music Therapy Protocol Standardized for Dementia Agitation
snippet: Evidence-based music intervention protocol demonstrates consistent reduction in agitation and anxiety across dementia stages in multicenter trial.

headline: Advanced Directive Planning Tool for Dementia Patients
snippet: Digital platform facilitates early advance care planning conversations, resulting in higher completion rates of legally valid dementia-specific directives.

headline: Multidisciplinary Team Approach Cuts Antipsychotic Use in Dementia
snippet: Collaborative care model reduces inappropriate antipsychotic prescribing by 60% through behavioral intervention specialists and pharmacist consultation.

headline: Dementia-Friendly Hospital Design Reduces Patient Distress
snippet: Environmental modifications including clear signage, reduced noise, and dedicated quiet spaces decrease confusion and falls in hospitalized dementia patients.

headline: Nutritional Intervention Slows Functional Decline in Dementia
snippet: Medical nutrition therapy with specific micronutrient supplementation shows significant preservation of activities of daily living in moderate dementia.

headline: Comprehensive Driving Assessment Protocol for Dementia Patients
snippet: Standardized driving evaluation combining cognitive testing and road assessment safely identifies driving competence while preserving patient autonomy.

headline: End-of-Life Care Pathway Improves Comfort in Advanced Dementia
snippet: Structured palliative care pathway ensures appropriate symptom management and reduces aggressive interventions in final stages of dementia.
